Color Scheme

The website uses a 3 color scheme. By default the primary color is red, with two more colors based on the split complimentary (itâ€™s color theory.) You can of course change them to whatever you wish. Most of the colors are based on one of these three, like the background.


Color Scheme
					
$primary-hue: 355;
$primary-color: hsl($primary-hue, 100%, 50%);
$secondary-color: adjust-hue($primary-color, 150deg);
$tertiary-color: adjust-hue($primary-color, 210deg);
$background-col: lighten(desaturate($primary-color, 95%), 30%);

Body Width

By default the body is 97% wide and has a margin to center it.


Body Width
						
$body-width

Column Widths

CSimple uses a six column layout. To note the width of different columns, you can include classes from col1 (this is one column wide) to col6 (this spans the entire width of the page.) These elements must be contained within a parent element that has the row class.


Examples of column widths
					
(Insert example code here)

Here are the variables controlling the width of the columns, as well as the size of the margin.


Column Widths
					
$column1width: 15%;
$column2width: 30%;
$column3width: 45%;
$column4width: 60%;
$column5width: 75%;
$column6width: 90%;
$column-margin: 3%;

Fonts

To help readability, three types of fonts are used on page. One is reserved for headers, one is used for code, and there is the main font used for most of the content on the page. The default fonts are generic web safe fonts, so feel free to replace them with your own.


Font Families
						
$content-font: Georgia, serif;
$header-font: Arial, sans-serif;
$code-font: "Courier New", Courier, monospace;
